summary: Praying mantises are a group of over 2,400 insect species found worldwide. They have unique triangular heads with big eyes and flexible necks. Their bodies are long, and they have strong, enlarged front legs for catching prey, earning them the name "praying mantis." Mantises are related to termites and cockroaches. They are predators, often ambushing their prey. They live for about a year, and females sometimes eat their mates. People have kept them as pets for a long time, and they are often seen as mysterious and powerful in different cultures.
title: Mantis
